alert.note: Alert for Atchison; Leavenworth (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 7:08AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Leavenworth, Atchison, southwestern Buchanan and northwestern Platte Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 708 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rushville to near Atchison to near Nortonville to 6 miles southwest of Effingham. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leavenworth, Atchison, Weston, Effingham, Dearborn, Rushville, Easton, Tracy, Muscotah, Lewis And Clark Village, De Kalb, Farmington, Iatan, Fort Leavenworth, Arrington, Bean Lake, Lewis And Clark Vi, Beverly, Lowemont and Cummings. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 26 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas...and northwestern and west central Missouri.
